title: Best Online Indiana Real Estate Schools in 2025
excerpt: Selecting the right online Indiana real estate school is a key step in building your career, making it essential to carefully explore your options and…
content:
Selecting the right online Indiana real estate school is a key step in building your career, making it essential to carefully explore your options and fully understand what each course provides. Although there are numerous real estate schools out there, only a handful truly excel in delivering top-notch education and thorough support to help you secure your real estate license.

At Smart Agent Alliance, we’re dedicated to helping new agents kickstart successful careers. That’s why we’ve compiled a list of the top online Indiana real estate schools. Our in-depth review highlights each school’s offerings, course delivery methods, and provides a well-rounded perspective on the pros and cons of studying with them.

  1. The CE Shop
  2. Colibri Real Estate
  3. The Indiana Real Estate Institute
  4. McColly Real Estate

The CE Shop

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A
Top Feature: Course is easy to follow, high pass rates among students

Why We Chose It: The CE Shop offers a variety of real estate education options with an interactive and inquiry-based approach in their studying methods. While their focus is mainly on continuing education, they also provide excellent pre-licensing courses, exam prep, and post-licensing education. Their courses are accredited by ARELLO and have received numerous awards for their educational programs.

Overview: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses can be taken in 34 states, through four different course packages: Courses Only, Standard Package, Value Package, and Premium Package. Every package comes with business ebooks, career resources, downloadable resources, real estate glossary, digital flashcards, study schedules, and access to instructor-led webinars. Students have praised the course content for being easy to follow and highly informative, which has led to high pass rates.

Why The CE Shop is Great for Pre-Licensing: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses emphasize real-world applications with scenario-based learning. This approach helps students apply their knowledge to practical situations they will face in their real estate careers. Additionally, The CE Shop provides an exam prep edge program that offers additional practice tests and study aids to ensure students are well-prepared for their licensing exams.

User Experiences and Feedback: The CE Shop is well-regarded for its robust customer support and comprehensive resources. The ability to access instructor-led webinars provides an additional layer of support and interaction, which can be particularly beneficial for students who need more guidance. The frequent promotions and discounts make it a cost-effective option for many. Students appreciate the clear and structured study schedules, which help them stay on track and complete the course efficiently.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $545
Basic Package Features: The $545, 90-hour Indiana Broker Pre-Licensing Course covers all mandatory topics needed for the Indiana salesperson license exam. The course prepares students for a real estate career, covering property ownership, contracts, financing, real estate math, Indiana laws, and more.
Upgrade Packages: The $955 Indiana Broker Pre-Licensing Premium Package includes 99 hours total, with 90 mandatory hours and 9 elective hours. It covers everything for licensing and the first license renewal. The package features the 90-hour course, Exam Prep Edge, and the ProPath Career Kickstarter program, offering 9 hours of professional development in business planning, lead generation, and negotiation. The first post-licensing package is also included.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $101.25
Basic Package Features: The Indiana Broker Exam Prep Edge covers both the national and state portions of the licensing exam. It offers an online study platform with an initial assessment, feedback, and dynamic practice exams. The program helps you focus on areas needing improvement, guided by real-time dashboards to ensure you’re ready for exam day.
Upgrade Packages: None 

Learning Format: Flexible, self-paced online courses.

Access Duration: Six months from the start date.

Money-Back Guarantee: Full refund within 30 days if less than 50% of the course is completed.

Pass Assurance: Exam cost reimbursed if you don’t pass on the first attempt.

Exam Preparation: Targeted review sessions, custom study plans, unlimited practice tests, and live webinars.

Support Services: Available daily via email, phone, or chat.

Final Exam Procedure: Online proctoring available nationwide; California exams are administered by the DRE at specific centers.

Extra Resources: Includes digital flashcards, a real estate glossary, a study schedule, business courses, and state-specific content.

Pros:

  • Multiple study package options and monthly payment plans
  • High pass rates among students
  • Interactive and easy-to-follow course material
  • Frequent discounts and promotions

Cons:

  • Mainly text-based study materials
  • Some students find the materials take longer to complete than expected
  • Limited coverage of real estate math

To view their current pricing for pre-licensing, first click this linked button, then under the main heading select “Real Estate” then fill in your State, Education, and License type (Your State, Pre-Licencing, Sales-Licencing)

Colibri Real Estate

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A
Top Feature: Affordable and comprehensive study materials

Why We Chose It: Colibri Real Estate is known for its affordability and thorough course materials. It provides excellent support to students preparing for their exams and offers a range of courses that cater to different learning needs. Colibri’s courses are designed to be clear and easy to understand, making them a great choice for budget-conscious students.

Overview: Colibri Real Estate offers various online courses with comprehensive study materials. The courses are designed to prepare students effectively for their licensing exams, with detailed support and resources. The pricing is competitive, making it an accessible option for many students.

Why Colibri Real Estate is Great for Pre-Licensing: Colibri Real Estate’ pre-licensing courses include interactive study tools such as flashcards, practice tests, and exam simulators. The courses are state-approved and designed to meet all the requirements for licensure. Colibri also offers a “pass or don’t pay” guarantee, ensuring students can retake the course if they don’t pass the exam on the first try. They also provide a career starter guide to help new agents transition smoothly into their real estate careers.

User Experiences and Feedback: Colibri Real Estate has a strong reputation for providing value for money. The comprehensive study materials are frequently updated to reflect the latest industry standards and practices. Students have noted that the detailed exam preparation support, including practice exams and study guides, is particularly helpful for passing the state licensing exams. The school’s customer support, though sometimes slow, is knowledgeable and helpful in resolving issues.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $376.20
Basic Package Features: “The Basics” package, priced at $376.20 (40% off with code LEARN40), includes the 90-hour pre-license course, state-approved instructor support, 3 study guides, narrated audio with adjustable speeds, and Buffini & Company career coaching videos. It’s ideal for disciplined self-starters in real estate.
Upgrade Packages: The “Ultimate Learning” package, discounted to $539.40 with code LEARN40, offers a comprehensive learning experience for aspiring real estate professionals. It includes the 90-hour pre-license course, live webinars, CompuCram exam prep, Buffini & Company career coaching, and a 1-year Career Booster Pack. The package also features printed textbooks, unlimited practice tests, and a “Pass or Don’t Pay” guarantee, ensuring you’re fully prepared for the Indiana real estate exam.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $69
Basic Package Features: The “Exam Prep” package, priced at $69 with code LEARN40, provides practice tests that simulate the real exam and help you master common topics. It includes audio playback of course summaries and comes with a “Pass or Don’t Pay” guarantee, ensuring you’re prepared for the licensing exam.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, the “Exam Prep Ultimate” package, available for $269.40 with code LEARN40, combines the Live package with a Post-License Course for ongoing career development. It includes live Q&A sessions, a Live Exam Crammer series of webinars, and audio playback for exam prep. The package also features a “Pass or Don’t Pay” guarantee and self-paced post-license courses to complete your education requirements at your convenience.

Post-Licensing

Price Starts at: $183.20
Basic Package Features: The Indiana Broker Post-License Course, priced at $183.20 with code HOT20, includes 30 mandatory hours of state-required education. It offers self-paced, narrated audio coursework and access to expert instructors. Additionally, the package includes a free 1-year RISMedia Premier Membership, valued at $249, providing unlimited access to industry resources, reports, and exclusive events for professional growth.
Upgrade Packages: None 

Learning Options: Choose between self-paced online courses or live-streamed classes with real-time instructors for a classroom-like experience from home.

Course Access: Six months of access from the enrollment date.

Refund Policy: Full refund for self-paced courses if canceled within 30 days, and within 24 hours for live-stream courses.

Pass Guarantee: For packages with exam prep, Colibri will refund the course cost if you score 80% or higher on simulated exams but don’t pass the state exam on the first try.

Exam Preparation: Includes digital flashcards, mock exams, readiness assessments, audio review guides, live Q&A sessions, and six one-hour live webinars with instructors for focused preparation.

Instructor Support: Available by phone during business hours or via email for additional assistance.

Final Exam Process: Virtual proctoring available nationwide; in California, the DRE administers the exam at designated centers.

Additional Resources: Access to state-specific pre-licensing, continuing education, broker licensing, and mortgage licensing courses, as well as practice exams and a real estate dictionary.

Pros:

  • Affordable courses
  • Comprehensive study materials
  • Detailed exam preparation support

Cons:

  • Limited interactivity in course materials
  • Some students found customer support to be slow

To view their current pricing, click this linked button, then select your desired State, Education Selection, and Education Option Selection.

The Indiana Real Estate Institute

SmartAgentAlliance Score: B+
Top Feature: Course is easy to follow, with a strong focus on practical applications.

Why We Chose It: The Indiana Real Estate Institute offers a range of real estate education options that are specifically tailored to Indiana’s requirements. Their approach is interactive and scenario-based, emphasizing real-world situations that students will encounter in their careers. While they focus on comprehensive pre-licensing courses, they also provide robust exam prep and post-licensing education. The institute’s programs are designed to be both accessible and informative, helping students gain the knowledge they need to succeed.

Overview: The Indiana Real Estate Institute’s pre-licensing courses are available across the state, offering flexible learning options through several different course packages. These include resources like business ebooks, career tools, downloadable materials, a real estate glossary, digital flashcards, and study schedules. Additionally, students can benefit from access to live webinars led by experienced instructors. The course content is highly praised for its clarity and ease of understanding, leading to strong pass rates among students.

Why Indiana Real Estate Institute is Great for Pre-Licensing: The Indiana Real Estate Institute’s pre-licensing courses are designed with a strong emphasis on practical, real-world applications. Their scenario-based learning model helps students apply what they learn directly to the situations they will face in their real estate careers. The institute also offers an enhanced exam prep program that includes additional practice tests and study aids, ensuring students are thoroughly prepared for their licensing exams.

User Experiences and Feedback: The Indiana Real Estate Institute is known for its excellent customer support and comprehensive educational resources. The opportunity to participate in instructor-led webinars adds an extra layer of support, making the learning experience more interactive and engaging. The institute’s frequent promotions and discounts make it a cost-effective choice for many aspiring real estate professionals. Students particularly appreciate the clear, structured study schedules that help them stay on track and complete their courses efficiently.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $579
Basic Package Features: The “Basic Plus” package, priced at $579, includes everything in the Basic Package plus printed copies of the course manual, handouts, study guide, and a guide for the Indiana exam portion. It also offers instructor support via email.
Upgrade Packages: The “Premier” package, now $595, includes everything in the Basic Plus Package, with added exam study guides, national and state-specific questions, 150+ videos, a private Facebook group, pre-recorded study sessions, discounts on future classes, and 700+ digital flashcards.

Post Licensing

Price Starts at: $199
Basic Package Features: The “Broker Post-Licensing” course is mandatory for new Indiana brokers within two years of licensing. The course is designed to be entertaining, engaging, and educational, ensuring you learn everything needed to pass the state exam and excel as an agent. While it’s offered in-person occasionally, the online course is recommended for convenience.
Upgrade Packages: None

Learning Formats: The Indiana Real Estate Institute offers self-paced online courses that include engaging video lessons and downloadable materials, allowing you to study at your own convenience. The courses are compatible with any device, making it easy to learn whenever and wherever you choose.

Course Access: Courses are accessible for 12 months from the date of enrollment, providing you with plenty of time to complete your studies at a comfortable pace.

Refund Policy: The Indiana Real Estate Institute offers a 30-day satisfaction guarantee. If you are not satisfied and have completed less than 50% of the course, you can request a refund within this period.

Exam Preparation: The courses come with comprehensive state exam study guides, sample questions, practice exams, and an “Agent Success Course” designed to thoroughly prepare you for the licensing exam.

Student Support: The institute provides responsive customer support available via email, ensuring assistance is always at hand whenever you have questions or encounter any issues.

Additional Resources: The Indiana Real Estate Institute offers a variety of additional learning materials, including infographic resources, e-textbooks, and detailed lesson outlines to enhance your educational experience. They also provide specialized courses in areas such as real estate investment, covering topics like real estate accounting, syndication, and off-market transactions.

Pros:

  • Affordable prices and frequent discounts
  • Flexibility to study on the go with audio courses
  • 30-day money-back guarantee

Cons:

  • Study materials may not be as in-depth
  • No live instructor support
  • Limited additional study materials

McColly Real Estate

SmartAgentAlliance Score: B-
Top Feature: Course is easy to follow, with high pass rates among students.

Why We Chose It: McColly Real Estate offers a diverse range of real estate education options, focusing on practical, hands-on learning. While they excel in continuing education, their pre-licensing courses, exam prep, and post-licensing education are also top-notch. Their programs are accredited and have been recognized for their excellence in training real estate professionals.

Overview: McColly Real Estate’s pre-licensing courses are available across multiple states, offering several comprehensive course packages: Courses Only, Standard Package, Value Package, and Premium Package. Each package includes business ebooks, career resources, downloadable materials, a real estate glossary, digital flashcards, study schedules, and access to instructor-led webinars. Students consistently commend the course content for its clarity and effectiveness, which has contributed to their high pass rates.

Why McColly Real Estate is Great for Pre-Licensing: McColly Real Estate’s pre-licensing courses emphasize real-world applications through scenario-based learning, helping students translate theoretical knowledge into practical skills. They also offer an exam prep program that includes practice tests and study aids, ensuring students are thoroughly prepared for their licensing exams.

User Experiences and Feedback: McColly Real Estate is highly regarded for its strong customer support and extensive resources. The availability of instructor-led webinars provides additional guidance and interaction, which is especially valuable for students needing extra support. Frequent promotions and discounts make their courses an affordable option for many. Students appreciate the structured study schedules, which help them stay organized and complete their courses efficiently.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $499
Basic Package Features: The Indiana Broker Pre-licensing course, priced at $499, covers the 90 hours required for the Indiana real estate broker licensing exam. The curriculum includes topics such as real estate concepts, property basics, contracts, finance, valuation, Indiana Real Estate License Law, and more, ensuring you’re fully prepared for the exam and your career.
Upgrade Packages: The Indiana Premium Package, priced at $589 (discounted from $643), includes the 90-hour Indiana Broker Prelicensing course, a Student Workbook, and the Indiana Broker Review Crammer. This package prepares students for the state exam and a successful real estate career. It features a comprehensive online course, key concept reviews, hundreds of practice questions, and a workbook that complements the online content, covering essential real estate topics.

Continuing Education

Price Starts at: $79
Basic Package Features: The “Broker and Managing Broker 12 Hour CE Package with Ethics,” priced at $79 (discounted from $117), includes 12 hours of continuing education covering fair housing laws, residential contract issues, and the National Association of REALTORS® Code of Ethics. The course explores anti-discrimination laws, contract nuances, and ethical practices, helping brokers meet state and REALTOR® association requirements.
Upgrade Packages: None

Post Licensing

Price Starts at: $249
Basic Package Features: The Indiana Real Estate Broker Post License Course, priced at $249, provides 30 hours of essential education for brokers. It covers key topics including contracts, client relationships, negotiations, fair housing, financing, and business management, ensuring brokers are well-prepared for their professional growth.
Upgrade Packages: None

Learning Formats: McColly Real Estate offers self-paced online courses that are accessible 24/7 from any device. The courses are designed to be engaging, utilizing a blend of text, videos, images, and quizzes to enhance understanding and retention.

Course Access: Students have access to their courses for an entire year, giving them plenty of time to complete the material at their own pace.

Refund Policy: McColly Real Estate provides a 72-hour refund policy, allowing students to cancel their purchase and receive a full refund within this period if they are not satisfied.

Exam Preparation: The platform includes comprehensive exam prep materials, such as practice exams, a real estate math course, and study guides to help students prepare effectively for their licensing exams. Additionally, they offer proctored final exams for states that require it.

Student Support: Customer support is available seven days a week through live chat and toll-free phone calls to assist students with any issues they might encounter.

Additional Resources: McColly Real Estate offers a wide selection of elective courses for continuing education (CE), covering topics like tax-favorable real estate transactions and client-focused communications. These courses are available in multiple states.

Pros:

  • Affordable course packages
  • Flexible self-paced learning options
  • Customer support available seven days a week

Cons:

  • Course materials are primarily text-based
  • Some reports of software and customer service issues

Our Review Process:

At SmartAgentAlliance, our goal is to provide accurate and helpful reviews of online real estate schools to assist prospective real estate agents in making informed decisions. Our review process involves several key steps:

Research and Data Collection:

We begin by gathering comprehensive information about each real estate school, including course offerings, pricing, accreditation, and user reviews. This involves visiting the schools’ websites, reading third-party reviews, and gathering feedback from current and former students.

Evaluation Criteria:

Our evaluation is based on several important criteria, including:

  • Course Quality: We assess the content and structure of the courses to ensure they cover all necessary topics comprehensively and are easy to follow.
  • Accessibility: We evaluate the flexibility and accessibility of the courses, including the availability of mobile apps and study materials.
  • Pass Rates: We consider the pass rates of students who have completed the courses and taken the licensing exam.
  • Student Support: We look at the level of support provided to students, including access to instructors, customer service, and additional resources like study guides and practice exams.
  • Pricing: We compare the cost of the courses relative to the value they offer, including any discounts or payment plans available.
  • User Feedback: We gather and analyze feedback from students who have taken the courses to get an understanding of their experiences and satisfaction levels.

Scoring and Ranking:

Each school is scored based on the evaluation criteria, and an overall score is calculated. The scores are then used to rank the schools, with additional considerations given to standout features that may set a school apart from the rest.

The cost of online real estate courses varies by school and package. Basic pre-license courses can start around $100, while comprehensive packages with additional features like exam prep and career support can cost several hundred dollars.

Most online real estate schools offer a refund policy, typically within a certain period (e.g., 30 days) if you haven’t completed a significant portion of the course. Check the specific refund policy of the school you choose.

title: Sotheby's vs Keller Williams: Which is Best for Realtors?
excerpt: This article will provide a comprehensive comparison between Sotheby's vs Keller Williams to help you determine which brokerage better aligns with your professional goals. Choosing…
content:
This article will provide a comprehensive comparison between Sotheby’s vs Keller Williams to help you determine which brokerage better aligns with your professional goals. Choosing the right brokerage is a critical decision for any real estate agent, as it significantly impacts their career trajectory and financial success.

Commission Splits and Fees
Income Opportunities
Training and Support
Technology and Resources
Agent Satisfaction
Final Thoughts on Sotheby’s vs Keller Williams
Join Our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Commission Splits and Fees

The commission splits and associated fees are crucial factors to consider when selecting a brokerage. Sotheby’s offers agent/broker commission splits ranging from 70/30 to 90/10, with a 6% franchise/royalty fee. This means that agents at Sotheby’s can retain between 70% to 90% of their commissions but must pay a 6% fee on their gross commission income. In contrast, Keller Williams provides flexible splits starting at 70/30 and going up to 100/0, with a 6% franchise/royalty fee until the cap is reached. Therefore, agents at Keller Williams can retain between 70% to 100% of their commissions, subject to the 6% fee until the cap.

Monthly fees also differ significantly between the two brokerages. Sotheby’s monthly fees vary by office location, reflecting differences in local markets and office operating costs. Keller Williams’ fees also vary by office, but they do not charge transaction fees, whereas Sotheby’s includes transaction fees within their royalty fees. Additionally, Errors & Omissions insurance at Keller Williams costs between $122 to $350 per month, while at Sotheby’s, it is a flat $2200 per year. These differences can impact an agent’s net income and financial planning, making it important to consider each brokerage’s fee structure carefully.

Income Opportunities

The potential for additional income streams can significantly enhance an agent’s financial stability and growth. Keller Williams stands out by offering revenue share programs that provide a retirement and willable income path. These additional income streams can offer substantial long-term financial benefits and security. Conversely, Sotheby’s does not offer such supplementary income opportunities, limiting agents primarily to their commission-based earnings.

Training and Support

Effective training and support are vital for both new and experienced agents. Keller Williams provides extensive training opportunities through its educational courses, which cost between $299 to $2500 per course. Agents at Keller Williams also benefit from various support structures, although 24/7 support is not available. In contrast, Sotheby’s provides training that varies by office, which might lead to inconsistencies in the quality of training received. Neither brokerage offers 24/7 support, which can be crucial for agents who require ongoing assistance and professional development.

Technology and Resources

In the modern real estate landscape, leveraging technology effectively is essential. Keller Williams is known for its robust technology platforms, offering tools that enhance productivity and client engagement. On the other hand, Sotheby’s also incorporates advanced technological tools tailored to the luxury market, including sophisticated marketing tools and CRM systems designed for high-net-worth clients. Both brokerages provide valuable technological resources, but the specific tools and platforms offered may appeal differently depending on the agent’s needs.

Agent Satisfaction

Agent satisfaction is a key indicator of a brokerage’s effectiveness and overall agent happiness. Keller Williams boasts a high Glassdoor rating of 4.3 stars based on 7.9K reviews, indicating strong agent approval and satisfaction. Sotheby’s holds a respectable rating of 4.0 stars from 501 reviews, suggesting that there are areas needing improvement. The differences in agent satisfaction can often be attributed to the varying levels of support, training, and income opportunities provided by each brokerage.

Final Thoughts on Sotheby’s vs Keller Williams

In comparing Sotheby’s and Keller Williams, it’s evident that each brokerage has its strengths and weaknesses. Keller Williams offers more favorable commission splits, extensive training, and additional income opportunities, making it a compelling choice for both new and experienced agents. The innovative technology and comprehensive support further enhance Keller Williams’ appeal. Sotheby’s, with its prestigious brand and focus on the luxury market, offers a traditional structure with consistent fee inclusions but lacks the supplementary income paths available at Keller Williams.

For a more detailed comparison and to find the best brokerage for your needs, check out our brokerage comparison tool. When making your decision, consider your specific needs and career objectives. Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages carefully to choose the brokerage that best fits your professional aspirations. Whether you prioritize comprehensive support and training or seek a brokerage with a more conventional setup, your decision should align with your long-term career goals and preferences.

title: Compass vs Redfin: Which is Best for Realtors in 2025?

content:
This article will provide a comprehensive comparison between Compass vs Redfin to help you determine which brokerage better aligns with your professional goals. Choosing the right brokerage is a critical decision for any real estate agent, as it significantly impacts their career trajectory and financial success.

Commission Splits and Fees
Income Opportunities
Training and Support
Technology and Resources
Agent Satisfaction
Final Thoughts on Compass vs Redfin
Join Our FREE Team at eXp Realty

Commission Splits and Fees

The commission splits and associated fees are crucial factors to consider when selecting a brokerage. Compass offers splits ranging from 60/40 to 92.5/7.5, with no franchise/royalty fee, and only some agents get a cap. In contrast, Redfin provides splits starting at 30/70 and going up to 75/25, also with no franchise/royalty fee, and no cap.

Monthly fees also differ significantly. Compass charges $145, varying by office, whereas Redfin has no monthly fees. Additionally, Compass charges transaction fees up to 4%, while Redfin does not charge transaction fees. These differences can impact an agent’s net income and financial planning, making it important to consider each brokerage’s fee structure.

Income Opportunities

The potential for additional income streams can significantly enhance an agent’s financial stability and growth. Unfortunately, neither Compass nor Redfin offers revenue share programs, retirement income paths, or willable income paths, limiting agents primarily to their commission-based earnings.

Training and Support

Effective training and support are vital for both new and experienced agents. Compass offers training through Compass Academy, providing structured learning opportunities. In contrast, Redfin provides four weeks of local training, which might be beneficial for hands-on learning. Neither brokerage offers 24/7 support, which can be crucial for agents who require ongoing assistance and professional development.

Technology and Resources

In the modern real estate landscape, leveraging technology effectively is essential. Compass is recognized for its technological advancements and robust tools available through Compass Academy. On the other hand, Redfin is also known for its technology-driven approach, providing agents with comprehensive tools and resources. Both brokerages provide valuable technological resources, but the specific tools and platforms offered may appeal differently depending on the agent’s needs.

Agent Satisfaction

Agent satisfaction is a key indicator of a brokerage’s effectiveness and overall agent happiness. Compass has a Glassdoor rating of 3.7 stars based on 2.4K reviews, indicating areas needing improvement. Redfin holds a slightly lower rating of 3.6 stars from 1.9K reviews, suggesting similar areas for improvement. The differences in agent satisfaction can often be attributed to the varying levels of support, training, and income opportunities provided by each brokerage.

Final Thoughts on Compass vs Redfin

In comparing Compass and Redfin, it’s evident that each brokerage has its strengths and weaknesses. Compass offers a more advanced technological platform and structured training through Compass Academy, making it appealing for agents who prioritize continuous learning and modern tools. Redfin, with its no-fee structure and comprehensive local training, may attract agents looking for a cost-effective and hands-on learning environment.

title: How to Get Your Georgia Real Estate License
excerpt: Launching your real estate career in Georgia may feel daunting, but with the right direction, it’s a clear and attainable process. This in-depth guide will…
content:
Launching your real estate career in Georgia may feel daunting, but with the right direction, it’s a clear and attainable process. This in-depth guide will lead you through every crucial step, making sure you’re well-prepared to start your real estate journey in the Peach State. Let’s begin your path to becoming a licensed real estate agent in Georgia.

  1. Basic Requirements
  2. Choosing a Real Estate School
  3. Find a Sponsoring Broker
  4. Why Join Smart Agent Alliance?

Basic Requirements

Before diving into the details, it’s important to grasp the fundamental requirements for obtaining a real estate license in Georgia. Here are the key criteria you need to meet:

To be eligible for a real estate license in Georgia, applicants must be at least 18 years old. This requirement ensures candidates possess the maturity and legal responsibility necessary for a career in real estate.

While Georgia does not require you to be a resident to apply for a real estate license, you must provide a valid Social Security number. This is essential for background checks and compliance with state regulations. Non-residents must adhere to the same standards as Georgia residents.

Integrity is a cornerstone of the real estate profession. The Georgia Real Estate Commission will conduct a comprehensive background check. Any criminal convictions could result in the denial of your license. Being transparent about any legal issues and showing evidence of rehabilitation can strengthen your application.

In Georgia, you are required to complete 75 hours of pre-licensing education. This course covers fundamental topics, including real estate principles, practices, and Georgia-specific laws, to fully equip you for the licensing exam and your real estate career.

The Georgia pre-licensing course offers detailed instruction in various essential areas of real estate. This includes a strong emphasis on real estate finance, agency laws, property transactions, and civil rights laws, ensuring you acquire the comprehensive knowledge needed to thrive in the industry.

This category encompasses the foundational aspects of real estate, including Property Ownership, where you learn about the legal dimensions of owning real estate. Land Use Controls and Regulations will cover essential zoning laws and environmental restrictions, while Valuation and Market Analysis provide insights into appraising properties and understanding market trends. Financing topics explore the various options and processes involved in securing mortgages and loans, crucial for facilitating real estate transactions.

A critical aspect of your real estate career is understanding the legal and ethical frameworks. This group includes General Principles of Agency, which delves into the responsibilities and relationships between agents and clients. Contracts are a significant portion, emphasizing the creation, execution, and implications of real estate agreements. Additionally, Transfer of Title examines the procedures involved in transferring ownership, and Practice of Real Estate covers everyday ethical considerations in the industry.

This category is all about applying your knowledge in real-world scenarios. Property Management introduces the basics of managing different types of properties. Real Estate Calculations is focused on the mathematical skills necessary for determining prices, taxes, and other financial details related to property transactions. These topics prepare you to handle the daily operational aspects of a real estate career.

The Georgia state-specific exam focuses on several critical areas unique to the state. This includes a thorough understanding of Georgia License Law, which governs the process of obtaining and maintaining a real estate license. You’ll also need to grasp the intricacies of Brokerage Relationships, detailing the responsibilities and agency relationships as outlined by Georgia law. Managing Trust Accounts is another key area, covering the proper handling of client funds. Additionally, the exam will test your knowledge of Management and Handling of Property, with laws specific to Georgia, and Georgia Fair Housing Laws, which include specific provisions that apply within the state.

Choosing a Real Estate School

Selecting the right real estate school is crucial. Look for accredited schools that offer flexibility, especially if you have a busy schedule. Online courses can provide the convenience of studying at your own pace.

Research Schools

Start by researching various real estate schools and reading reviews from past students. Look for schools with high pass rates for the real estate exam and positive feedback on their teaching methods.

Online vs In-Person Classes

Decide whether you prefer online or in-person classes. Online courses offer flexibility and convenience, allowing you to study at your own pace. In-person classes provide direct interaction with instructors and peers, which can enhance your learning experience.

Evaluate Course Materials

Evaluate the course materials and support services provided by the school. High-quality textbooks, interactive lessons, and access to instructors for questions can significantly impact your success. Some schools also offer additional resources like exam prep courses and study groups.

Study Tips

Create a daily study schedule that covers all exam topics, ensuring regular review sessions. (Asana provides a great FREE task manager)

Utilize flashcards for key terms and concepts to enhance memorization. (These Quizlet Flashcards may be helpful)

Regularly take practice tests to gauge your understanding and get familiar with the exam format. (Free Georgia Real Estate Practice Exam)

After finishing your pre-licensing coursework, the next step is to submit your license application to the Georgia Real Estate Commission (GREC).

Complete the Application Form: Fill out the application form, which is available online on the Georgia Real Estate Commission’s website.

Gather Required Documents: Collect all necessary documents, including proof of completed pre-licensing education, identification, and any other required paperwork.

Submit Your Application: Submit your application and all required documents through the GREC’s online portal.

Pay the Application Fee: Ensure you pay the required application fee, which is currently $170, through the online portal at the time of submission.

The Georgia Real Estate Commission typically takes a few weeks to process your application. During this time, they will review your educational transcripts and verify that you meet all necessary requirements. Make sure to review your application thoroughly to avoid any delays.

You can monitor your application status online through the Georgia Real Estate Commission’s website. Regularly checking on your application can help you stay informed of any potential issues or additional requirements. If any delays occur, contacting the Commission directly can help expedite the process.

The Georgia Real Estate Exam is a comprehensive assessment that lasts 4 hours and consists of 152 multiple-choice questions. To pass, you need to achieve a score of at least 75%. If you do not pass on your first attempt, you can retake the exam, but you will need to pay the exam fee of $121 for each attempt.

  • Property Ownership (10%)
  • Land Use Controls (5%)
  • Transfer of Title (6%)
  • Contracts (19%)
  • Agency (13%)
  • Property Disclosures (7%)
  • Practice of Real Estate (12%)
  • Valuation (8%)
  • Financing (10%)
  • Property Management (3%)
  • Real Estate Calculations (7%)

Exam Preparation Tips

Go over the textbooks and notes from your pre-license courses. Revisiting these materials can reinforce your understanding of key concepts. Focus on areas where you feel less confident to ensure a well-rounded preparation.

Take as many practice exams as possible. This helps you get familiar with the exam format and identify areas where you need more study. Practice exams can also help you manage your time effectively during the actual test. (Free Georgia Real Estate Practice Exam)

Join or form study groups. Discussing topics with peers can enhance understanding and retention. Study groups provide a platform to share knowledge, ask questions, and support each other.

Consider enrolling in an exam prep course for additional support and structured study. These courses often include practice exams, study guides, and expert instruction. Investing in a prep course can increase your chances of passing the exam on the first attempt.

Exam Day Tips

Ensure you arrive at the exam center early to avoid any last-minute stress. Arriving early gives you time to settle in and focus before the exam begins. Check the location and travel time in advance to plan your journey.

You’ll need a valid photo ID to enter the exam. Make sure your ID is current and matches the name on your application. Having all necessary documents ready can prevent any issues at the exam center.

Read each question carefully and manage your time wisely. Staying calm and composed can help you think clearly and avoid mistakes. Take deep breaths and stay positive throughout the exam.

Follow all instructions given by the exam proctors. Adhering to the rules ensures a smooth and fair testing experience for everyone. If you have any questions or issues, ask the proctors for assistance.

After passing the exam, you must complete the fingerprinting requirement as part of your background check. This step is essential to verify that you meet the honesty and integrity standards set by the Georgia Real Estate Commission (GREC).

Locate a Live Scan service provider approved by the Georgia Crime Information Center (GCIC). Live Scan is a secure and efficient electronic fingerprinting process. Schedule an appointment with a nearby provider. Costs typically range from $40 to $70.

Once fingerprinted, ensure that your prints are submitted directly to the Georgia Real Estate Commission..

The fees for fingerprinting vary by location and provider but generally fall between $40 and $70.

Background Check Process

The Georgia Real Estate Commission will conduct a background check using your fingerprints to ensure you meet the required ethical standards. Any issues identified during this check must be resolved before your license can be issued.

If any concerns arise during the background check, you may need to provide additional documentation or explanations. Being transparent about your past and taking responsibility can positively influence the Commission’s decision. It may be wise to seek legal advice if any complex issues arise.

The final step is to submit your Salesperson License Application to confirm that you have passed the exam and completed the fingerprinting requirement.

Fill out the Salesperson License Application form available on the Georgia Real Estate Commission (GREC) website. Ensure that all sections are accurately completed. The form can be accessed and submitted online.

Include proof that you passed the Georgia real estate exam. This documentation is essential for GREC to verify your eligibility. Keep a copy of your exam results for your personal records.

Attach your Live Scan Service form as proof that you have met the fingerprinting requirement. Make sure all required signatures and information are correctly provided.

As of 2024, the fee for the Salesperson License in Georgia is $170. This fee must be submitted along with your application. Keep a copy of your payment receipt for future reference.

After submitting your application, you can track its status online through the Georgia Real Estate Commission’s website. Regularly checking the status will keep you updated on any progress or additional requirements. If there are delays, contacting the Commission directly can provide clarity and help expedite the process. 

Find a Sponsoring Broker

Once you pass the exam, you need to find a sponsoring broker to activate your license. Look for a brokerage that aligns with your goals and offers the support you need.

What to Look For in a Broker

Find a supportive and collaborative environment. The right culture can significantly impact your job satisfaction and success.

Understand the financial arrangements. Different brokerages offer different commission splits, so choose one that suits your financial goals.

Choose a broker who provides ample training and mentorship opportunities. Early career support is crucial for your development and success.

17 Brokerage Interview Questions

  • What training programs do you offer for new agents?
  • How does your commission split work, and are there any additional fees?
  • What kind of support and resources will I have access to?
  • Can you provide references from other agents in your brokerage?

Top Brokerages to Consider

Choosing the right broker is crucial as it impacts your early career significantly. Consider top-rated brokers like eXp Realty, Keller Williams, Coldwell Banker, and Compass.

Why Join Smart Agent Alliance?

When you join Smart Agent Alliance, you get double the value because you’re also automatically a Wolf Pack member.  Together, Smart Agent Alliance and the Wolf Pack provide the tools, support, and expertise to elevate your business to new heights.

Smart Agent Alliance Benefits

At Smart Agent Alliance, we prioritize organization, clarity, and efficiency to help our agents succeed. We provide essential onboarding resources, customizable presentations, business automations, client checklists, business assets, social media content, YouTube support, a growth plan, quality lead generation, production know-how, website support, and top-notch organizational tools.

Wolf Pack Benefits

The Wolf Pack team at eXp Realty offers expert-led courses like Social Agent Academy 3.0, the Wolf Pack Hub, and the Investor Army for property flipping. We provide tailored assistance for new agents, developing agents, top producers, team leaders, and broker owners. Key resources include lead generation, production know-how, social media content, and YouTube support.

Why eXp Realty?

eXp Realty offers a comprehensive range of benefits for agents, focusing on top pay structures, low fees, and free stock options. Agents get an 80/20 commission splits that cap at $16,000 annually, with opportunities to earn 100% commission, receive annual stock awards and gain income through Revenue Share. Additional resources include 24/7 agent support, affordable healthcare, live training, and advanced tech tools like kvCORE and customizable IDX websites.

Starting a career in real estate involves some initial costs and financial planning. Understanding these costs and planning accordingly will help you manage your finances effectively.

Initial Expenses Breakdown

All stated fees are subject to change.

  • Initial Expenses: These include licensing fees, marketing expenses, office supplies, and technology tools needed to start your career. For example, initial expenses may include:
    • Pre-Licensing Course: $500+
    • Exam Fee: $119 per attempt
    • Application Fee: $170
    • Fingerprinting Fee: Roughly $40-70
    • Marketing Materials: Business cards, signage, and online advertising costs
  • When you join a brokerage in Georgia, many will require you to become a member of the National, State, and Local Associations of Realtors. Additionally, you’ll need to pay fees for the Multiple Listing Service (MLS) and Supra Key services.
    • National Association of Realtors (NAR):
      • Membership Fees: For 2024, the NAR annual dues are $156, plus a $45 special assessment fee for the Consumer Advertising Campaign, bringing the total to $201 per year.
    • Georgia Realtors (State Association):
      • Membership Fees: The annual dues for Georgia Realtors in 2024 are approximately $150. This fee is in addition to the NAR dues.
    • Local Association of Realtors:
      • Membership Fees: Local association fees in Georgia vary depending on the specific association. For example:
        • Atlanta Realtors Association: The annual dues are typically around $275 to $350.
        • Savannah Area Realtors: The fees generally range from $200 to $300 per year.
    • Multiple Listing Service (MLS):
      • Fees: MLS fees in Georgia also vary depending on the region. For example:
        • First Multiple Listing Service (FMLS): Fees are approximately $480 annually.
        • Georgia MLS (GAMLS): The fees typically range from $360 to $450 annually.
    • Supra Key Fees:
      • Fees: Supra Key services in Georgia typically include an initial setup fee of about $50 and a monthly service fee ranging from $20 to $25.
  • Create a Budget: Track your expenses and forecast your income. Plan for slower months to ensure financial stability.
  • Emergency Fund: Set aside an emergency fund to cover unexpected expenses or slow periods in the market
  • Commission Structure: Real estate agents typically earn commissions from sales. Understand how your brokerage’s commission structure works and how to manage irregular income streams. Commission splits can vary widely, typically ranging from 50/50 to 70/30 or higher, depending on the brokerage.
  • Tax Planning: As an independent contractor, it’s important to plan for taxes. Keep track of deductible expenses, make estimated tax payments, and maintain good record-keeping practices. Consulting with a tax professional can help ensure compliance and optimize your tax strategy.

To obtain a Georgia real estate license, you must meet the following requirements:

  1. Age: Be at least 18 years old.
  2. Education: Complete 75 hours of approved pre-licensing education.
  3. Background Check: Pass a fingerprint-based background check.
  4. Exam: Pass the Georgia real estate exam with a score of 75% or higher.
  5. Application: Submit a completed license application with the required fee.
  6. Sponsorship: Secure a sponsoring broker to activate your license.

These steps ensure you meet the state’s standards for becoming a licensed real estate agent in Georgia.

The cost to get a real estate license in Georgia typically includes the following:

  1. Pre-Licensing Course: $500+
  2. Exam Fee: $119 per attempt
  3. Application Fee: $170
  4. Fingerprinting Fee: $40-$70
  5. Other Costs: Marketing materials, association dues, and MLS fees (varies)

Overall, expect to invest around $800 to $1,000 or more, depending on additional expenses like association memberships and marketing materials.

Getting a real estate license in Georgia typically takes 3 to 6 months. This timeframe includes:

  1. Pre-Licensing Education: Completing the 75-hour course (2-4 weeks).
  2. Exam Preparation and Scheduling: Studying and booking the exam (2-4 weeks).
  3. Taking the Exam: Passing the Georgia real estate exam.
  4. Application Processing: Submitting the application and completing the background check (4-6 weeks).

The total duration depends on your pace in completing the coursework and scheduling the exam.

What is the pass rate for the real estate exam?

The pass rate for the Georgia real estate exam is approximately 60%. This means that around 60% of test-takers pass the exam on their first attempt. The exam is challenging, so thorough preparation is key to success.

What happens if I fail the real estate exam?

If you fail the Georgia real estate exam, you can retake it. Here’s what you need to know:

  1. Retake Policy: You can retake the exam as many times as needed, but you’ll have to pay the exam fee of $121 each time.
  2. Preparation: Consider reviewing the areas where you struggled and possibly taking additional study courses or practice exams.
  3. Scheduling: You can reschedule your retake as soon as you’re ready, depending on availability at the testing center.

Failing the exam is not uncommon, so it’s important to focus on improving your understanding of the material before attempting it again.

How do I renew my real estate license?

To renew your Georgia real estate license, follow these steps:

1. Complete Continuing Education: Complete 36 hours of approved continuing education (CE) courses every 4 years. This must include 3 hours of Georgia law.

2. Submit Renewal Application: Log in to the Georgia Real Estate Commission (GREC) website and submit your renewal application online.

3. Pay the Renewal Fee: Pay the renewal fee of $125 if submitted on time. Late renewals incur additional fees.

4. Renewal Deadline: Ensure you renew your license before the expiration date to avoid penalties or license suspension.

By following these steps, you can maintain your active real estate license in Georgia.

title: Best Online Georgia Real Estate Schools in 2025
excerpt: Selecting the right online real estate school in Georgia is a pivotal step in your career journey. It’s essential to carefully evaluate your options and…
content:
Selecting the right online real estate school in Georgia is a pivotal step in your career journey. It’s essential to carefully evaluate your options and understand what each course provides. While there are many schools to choose from, only a few truly excel in delivering top-notch education and robust support to help you earn your real estate license.

At Smart Agent Alliance, we’re dedicated to helping new agents build successful careers. That’s why we’ve compiled a list of the top online real estate schools in Georgia. Our thorough review explores each school’s offerings, course delivery methods, and provides an unbiased assessment of the pros and cons of studying with each one.

  1. AceableAgent
  2. The CE Shop
  3. Colibri Real Estate
  4. RealEstateU
  5. 360 Training

AceableAgent

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A+
Top Feature: Ability to study on the go with the mobile app

Why We Chose It:

AceableAgent has quickly become a favorite among students due to its modern approach and flexibility. It is exclusively focused on real estate education, offering courses for every step of a real estate career, from pre-licensing to continuing education and career advancement. The courses are state-approved and designed to be accessible from any device, providing students with the flexibility to study anywhere.

Overview:

AceableAgent offers three pre-licensing packages, all of which include the required coursework. The courses are fully online and accessible via desktop, laptop, tablet, or smartphone. This accessibility is one of AceableAgent’s standout features, allowing students to study on the go. Courses are developed by experienced professionals and are accredited by ARELLO. Additionally, AceableAgent is known for its interactive coursework, which helps students grasp and retain information effectively.

Why AceableAgent is Great for Pre-Licensing:

AceableAgent’s pre-licensing courses are available in multiple states, ensuring they meet state-specific requirements. The courses include engaging video lectures, interactive content, and practice exams to help students prepare effectively for their licensing exams. AceableAgent offers a satisfaction guarantee and provides career resources to help new agents start their careers successfully.

User Experiences and Feedback:

Students have reported that AceableAgent’s courses are particularly user-friendly, with a modern interface that makes navigation easy. The mobile app is highly rated for its convenience, allowing users to study during commutes or breaks. The interactive content, including quizzes and video explanations, has been praised for making complex topics easier to understand. Additionally, AceableAgent’s customer service, though sometimes slow, is generally helpful and responsive to student needs.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $219
Basic Package Features: The AceableAgent 75-Hour Course offers comprehensive support, including instructor access via email, fully narrated lessons and a Lite Exam Prep with 1,000 unique practice questions. Additionally, a mini-course is provided to help you find the right sponsoring broker for your career.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, the upgraded packages offer The Virtual Instructor package includes 24/7 AI-powered support for accelerated learning, along with 3 months of PrepAgent state exam prep. This comprehensive package features premium study aids, including videos, audio lessons, flashcards, and over 1,660 practice questions. Additionally, it offers a real estate exam prep ebook, live tutoring, webinars, and live Q&A sessions with expert tutors.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $59
Basic Package Features: Thousands of practice questions; 100% money-back guarantee; 75+ real estate exam prep videos; online interactive flashcards; 100+ page exam prep ebook; hours of audio lessons; interactive vocabulary worksheet; 100s of hours of recorded webinars; live online webinars.
Upgrade Packages: Yes, the upgraded packages offer access to PrepAgent for 1 or 2 months, compared to just 1 week with the basic plan.

Post Licensing

Price Starts at: $149
Basic Package Features: The AceableAgent 25-Hour Course provides flexible learning with instructor support available via email, interactive lessons to keep you engaged, and a self-paced format that allows you to complete the course at your own speed.

Flexible Learning Options: Enjoy self-paced courses that fit your schedule.

Extended Course Access: Access course materials for up to six months from your enrollment date.

Risk-Free Enrollment: Benefit from a 30-day money-back guarantee if you’re not satisfied.

Exam Success Guarantee: Pass the licensing exam within three tries or receive a full course refund.

Comprehensive Exam Preparation: Gain access to a variety of study tools including prep videos, 75 audio lessons, digital flashcards, over 1600 practice questions, a 100-page exam prep ebook, weekly live webinars, live Q&A sessions with instructors, and the option for personalized 1-on-1 tutoring.

Dedicated Support: Instructor assistance is available seven days a week via email, and customer service can be reached by email and phone from Monday to Friday.

Convenient Final Exams: Utilize online proctoring services for the final exam across the nation, although California students do not need a proctor for their pre-licensing exam.

Mobile-Friendly Platform: Study anytime, anywhere with a course platform that is fully optimized for mobile devices.

Interactive Learning Tools: Engage with interactive content designed to enhance your learning experience and retention.

Career Resources: Access additional career support services to help you transition from student to professional agent successfully.

Pros:

  • Mobile app for studying
  • High pass rates among schools with 1,000+ students
  • Engaging and entertaining course materials
  • Exam prep through PrepAgent

Cons:

  • Course access lasts for 12 months
  • Some bugs reported in the mobile app
  • Limited technical support
  • Outsourced exam proctoring

To view their current pricing for pre-licensing click this linked button. If you are interested in any of the other courses they offer, you can find that through this link as well.

The CE Shop

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A
Top Feature: Course is easy to follow, high pass rates among students

Why We Chose It: The CE Shop offers a variety of real estate education options with an interactive and inquiry-based approach in their studying methods. While their focus is mainly on continuing education, they also provide excellent pre-licensing courses, exam prep, and post-licensing education. Their courses are accredited by ARELLO and have received numerous awards for their educational programs.

Overview: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses can be taken in 34 states, through four different course packages: Courses Only, Standard Package, Value Package, and Premium Package. Every package comes with business ebooks, career resources, downloadable resources, real estate glossary, digital flashcards, study schedules, and access to instructor-led webinars. Students have praised the course content for being easy to follow and highly informative, which has led to high pass rates.

Why The CE Shop is Great for Pre-Licensing: The CE Shop’s pre-licensing courses emphasize real-world applications with scenario-based learning. This approach helps students apply their knowledge to practical situations they will face in their real estate careers. Additionally, The CE Shop provides an exam prep edge program that offers additional practice tests and study aids to ensure students are well-prepared for their licensing exams.

User Experiences and Feedback: The CE Shop is well-regarded for its robust customer support and comprehensive resources. The ability to access instructor-led webinars provides an additional layer of support and interaction, which can be particularly beneficial for students who need more guidance. The frequent promotions and discounts make it a cost-effective option for many. Students appreciate the clear and structured study schedules, which help them stay on track and complete the course efficiently.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $206.50
Basic Package Features: This package offers the 75 hours of required instruction for eligibility to obtain a Georgia Real Estate Salesperson license. It prepares students for the state licensing exam and provides essential knowledge in areas like license law, agency law, real property ownership, finance, marketing, property management, and real estate calculations.
Upgrade Packages: The 75-Hr. GA Sales Pre-Licensing Premium Package, priced at $605, includes 87 total hours (75 mandatory and 12 elective) and covers everything needed to obtain a Georgia real estate license. This package offers the required 75-hour licensing course, Exam Prep Edge, the eTextbook “Real Estate Basics and Beyond,” access to additional practice exams, and the Learning Library. It also includes the ProPath Real Estate Career Kickstarter, featuring three professional development courses focused on business planning, lead generation, and negotiation skills.

Exam Prep

Price Starts at: $101.25
Basic Package Features: The GA Salesperson Exam Prep Edge, priced at $135, is an online study program designed to prepare you for the national and state portions of the Georgia real estate licensing exam. It features an initial assessment with feedback, dynamic practice exams with unique questions, and a real-time dashboard to track your progress and focus on areas needing improvement. This tool helps you effectively prepare to ace your exam and kickstart your real estate career.
Upgrade Packages: None

Post-Licensing

Price Starts at: $149
Basic Package Features: The Georgia Post-Licensing for Real Estate Salespersons course, priced at $145, provides 25 mandatory hours designed to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical application in real estate. This course covers essential topics such as the listing process, property disclosures, buyer representation, purchase agreements, contracts, negotiation skills, the mortgage process, appraisals, ethical principles, and risk mitigation. It includes activities and scenarios to help you confidently apply what you’ve learned in real-world situations.
Upgrade Packages: Also includes the ProPath Real Estate Business Builder program enhances your real estate career with key professional development courses. It includes training on Pricing Strategies to help you effectively price homes and achieve sales goals, Tax Planning for the Self-Employed to manage finances and optimize tax savings, and Budget to Build Your Business, which guides you in estimating earnings, expenses, and creating a successful financial plan for your career.

License Renewal

Price Starts at: $145
Basic Package Features: The 27-Hr. GA CE First Renewal Package, priced at $145, provides the required 27 hours of continuing education (24 elective and 3 mandatory) for new licensees in Georgia. This package includes the necessary courses to complete the additional hours needed for the first license renewal, covering topics such as Georgia License Law, ethics, consumer protection, real estate finance, environmental awareness, personal safety, market analysis, and property inspections.
Upgrade Packages: In addition to the required CE courses, this package includes the ProPath Real Estate Business Builder program, offering nine hours of professional development in pricing strategies, tax planning for the self-employed, and budgeting for business success. These courses provide valuable knowledge but do not count toward CE credits.

Learning Format: Flexible, self-paced online courses.

Access Duration: Six months from the start date.

Money-Back Guarantee: Full refund within 30 days if less than 50% of the course is completed.

Pass Assurance: Exam cost reimbursed if you don’t pass on the first attempt.

Exam Preparation: Targeted review sessions, custom study plans, unlimited practice tests, and live webinars.

Support Services: Available daily via email, phone, or chat.

Final Exam Procedure: Online proctoring available nationwide; California exams are administered by the DRE at specific centers.

Extra Resources: Includes digital flashcards, a real estate glossary, a study schedule, business courses, and state-specific content.

Pros:

  • Multiple study package options and monthly payment plans
  • High pass rates among students
  • Interactive and easy-to-follow course material
  • Frequent discounts and promotions

Cons:

  • Mainly text-based study materials
  • Some students find the materials take longer to complete than expected
  • Limited coverage of real estate math

To view their current pricing for pre-licensing, first click this linked button, then under the main heading select “Real Estate” then fill in your State, Education, and License type (Your State, Pre-Licencing, Sales-Licencing)

Colibri Real Estate

SmartAgentAlliance Score: A
Top Feature: Affordable and comprehensive study materials

Why We Chose It: Colibri Real Estate is known for its affordability and thorough course materials. It provides excellent support to students preparing for their exams and offers a range of courses that cater to different learning needs. Colibri’s courses are designed to be clear and easy to understand, making them a great choice for budget-conscious students.

Overview: Colibri Real Estate offers various online courses with comprehensive study materials. The courses are designed to prepare students effectively for their licensing exams, with detailed support and resources. The pricing is competitive, making it an accessible option for many students.

Why Colibri Real Estate is Great for Pre-Licensing: Colibri Real Estate’ pre-licensing courses include interactive study tools such as flashcards, practice tests, and exam simulators. The courses are state-approved and designed to meet all the requirements for licensure. Colibri also offers a “pass or don’t pay” guarantee, ensuring students can retake the course if they don’t pass the exam on the first try. They also provide a career starter guide to help new agents transition smoothly into their real estate careers.

User Experiences and Feedback: Colibri Real Estate has a strong reputation for providing value for money. The comprehensive study materials are frequently updated to reflect the latest industry standards and practices. Students have noted that the detailed exam preparation support, including practice exams and study guides, is particularly helpful for passing the state licensing exams. The school’s customer support, though sometimes slow, is knowledgeable and helpful in resolving issues.

Pre-Licensing

Price Starts at: $179.40
Basic Package Features: The Pre-license Course includes a 75-hour state-approved pre-license course with instructor support, three real estate study guides, and accessible narrated audio with adjustable speeds. Additionally, it offers career support through Buffini & Company coaching videos, providing a comprehensive foundation for aspiring real estate professionals.
Upgrade Packages: The upgraded packages includes CompuCram Exam Prep, which offers simulated exams, flashcards, a readiness assessment, and audio review guides to prepare you thoroughly for your exams. Our Review Process:

At SmartAgentAlliance, our goal is to provide accurate and helpful reviews of online real estate schools to assist prospective real estate agents in making informed decisions. Our review process involves several key steps:

Research and Data Collection:

We begin by gathering comprehensive information about each real estate school, including course offerings, pricing, accreditation, and user reviews. This involves visiting the schools’ websites, reading third-party reviews, and gathering feedback from current and former students.

Evaluation Criteria:

Our evaluation is based on several important criteria, including:

  • Course Quality: We assess the content and structure of the courses to ensure they cover all necessary topics comprehensively and are easy to follow.
  • Accessibility: We evaluate the flexibility and accessibility of the courses, including the availability of mobile apps and study materials.
  • Pass Rates: We consider the pass rates of students who have completed the courses and taken the licensing exam.
  • Student Support: We look at the level of support provided to students, including access to instructors, customer service, and additional resources like study guides and practice exams.
  • Pricing: We compare the cost of the courses relative to the value they offer, including any discounts or payment plans available.
  • User Feedback: We gather and analyze feedback from students who have taken the courses to get an understanding of their experiences and satisfaction levels.

Scoring and Ranking:

Each school is scored based on the evaluation criteria, and an overall score is calculated. The scores are then used to rank the schools, with additional considerations given to standout features that may set a school apart from the rest.
